name: CKE
desc: TiArrow's flagship frame, the CKE offers the most enjoyable rider experience on the market. The seat, and ergonomic backrest work in concert with the side guards to provide unparalleled stability and the ultralightweight frame is easy to push and gentle on your shoulders. Available in titanium or magnesium (standard sizes only)

options.name: Titanium - Unpainted
options.desc: Titanium is a strong, beautiful material for a wheelchair frame.

options.name: Titanium - Painted
options.desc: Choose any of our standard colors for your Titanium frame.

options.name: Titanium - Painted Custom Color
options.desc: Choose any color you want for your Titanium frame. Browse through the colors at www.ralcolor.com. Just enter your chosen RAL Color number into the notes section at checkout.

options.name: Magnesium - Painted
options.desc: Magnesium is even lighter than Titanium.  Unlike Titanium, Magnesium must be painted.

options.name: Magnesium - Painted Custom Color
options.desc: Choose any color you want for your Magnesium frame. Browse through the colors at www.ralcolor.com. Just enter your chosen RAL Color number into the notes section at checkout.

options.name: Carbon Fiber
options.desc: An ultra lightweight, rigid, carbon fiber backrest, molded to fit the contours of your back and improve chair control. Tension adjustable with velcro straps.

options.name: Padded
options.desc: An ultra lightweight, rigid, carbon fiber backrest contoured to fit your back and padded for additional comfort. Tension adjustable with velcro straps.

options.name: Upholstery
options.desc: An ultra lightweight, rigid, carbon fiber backrest contoured to fit your body, padded for your comfort and upholstered with breathable mesh nylon. Tension adjustable with velcro straps.

options.name: sWeel
options.desc: A custom ultra lightweight 24-spoke wheel built around a carbon fiber hub, DT-Revolutions spokes, and a super lightweight rim makes the sWeel the lightest wheel on the market. (note: the sWeel is currently only available in a 25" (559) size)

options.name: Arrow Wheel
options.desc: By combining the carbon fiber hub of the sWeel and a slightly more basic wheel rim, the Arrow wheel is a great balance of quality, weight, and price.

options.name: Titanium
options.desc: Titanium is strong and light, but easily dented

options.name: Black Anodized Aluminum
options.desc: The aluminum hand rim is more dent resistant and slightly heavier.

options.name: Q-Grip from Out-front
options.desc: Top quality coated handrim that uses an exclusive anti-slip, latex free, neoprene coating that provides extra grip and control.

options.name: Magnesium -powder coated
options.desc: Magnesium is strong and light, but easily dented

options.name: 25mm Clamp Release
options.desc: A 25mm axle, secured to the frame with a quick-release clamp on the axle sleeve, provides unparallleled rigidity and responsiveness.

options.name: 1/2" Quick Release
options.desc: Standard, push button, quick-release axle.

options.name: Rightrun
options.desc: Supreme puncture protection and highly durable.

options.name: Schwalbe Low Tread
options.desc: Lightweight tires built for performance.

options.name: Extra light
options.desc: The lightest weight innertube around!

options.name: Standard
options.desc: The standard tire is more puncture resistant, but slightly heavier

options.name: Monofork with 4" Wheels
options.desc: Lightweight and simple. The monofork is easy to clean. It provides a nice balance between agility and a smooth ride.

options.name: Monofork with 5" Wheels
options.desc: Lightweight and simple. The monofork is easy to clean.  A bigger 5" wheel provides a smoother ride, though a little less agility. (Warning: it is not possible to combine a 5" caster wheel with a 24" rear wheel)

options.name: FrogLegs with 4" Wheels
options.desc: An adjustable suspension caster fork that absorbs the jolts and bumps of the road.  A standard 4" caster wheel provides a nice balance between agility and a smooth ride.

options.name: FrogLegs with 5" Wheels
options.desc: An adjustable suspension caster fork that absorbs the jolts and bumps of the road.  A bigger 5" wheel provides a smoother ride, though a little less agility. (Warning: it is not possible to combine a 5" caster wheel with a 24" rear wheel)

options.name: Out-Front Wheel Locks
options.desc: Tried and true standard brakes

options.name: Single Hand Operating Wheel Locks
options.desc: Compact, reliable, and opperable with just one hand.

options.name: No Wheel Locks
options.desc: Cutting weight? Live life on the edge with no wheel locks? you rebel you.

options.name: Plastic
options.desc: A firm sheet of plastc mounted inside the side tubes to keep your clothes clean.

options.name: Titanium
options.desc: A thin, strong sheet of titanium welded to the side tubes for maximum rigidity.

options.name: Carbon Fiber
options.desc: A strong carbon fiber side guard mounted inside the side tubes to improve stability and keep your clothes clean.

measures.name: Rear Seat Width
measures.desc: The distance between the outside of the seat tube on one side to the outside of the seat tube on the other side. Rear seat width helps determine side to side stability.
measures.details: Rear seat width helps determines how the frame fits your body and how much side to side stability you will have. A tighter seat width provides a sleeker appearance and increases your lateral stability. It also gives you easier access to the push rims. TiArrow uses a thin tube to outline the shape of the side guard, however. This adds rigidity to the frame and increases your lateral stability, but it also makes the frame fit your body a little differently. We suggest choosing a seat width that is .5? wider than you would otherwise get to ensure a comfortable fit.
measures.tip: An easy way to measure seat width is to press a book firmly against either hip and measure between them.
measures.gifDesc: As the seat width narrows, stability increases. As the seat widens, stability decreases.

measures.name: Seat Depth - Adjustable
measures.desc: The distance from your seat back to the front of your seat (typically where your seat cushion ends). Seat depth helps determine how pressure is distributed through your legs.
measures.details: To balance comfort and pressure distribution, we recommend a seat depth that is 5-8 cm  (2-3 inches) shorter than the length of your upper leg.  Too short a seat and the pressure may be too concentrated in your upper thighs, however too long a seat may press uncomfortably against the back of your lower leg.
measures.tip: We recommend that the seat depth be 5-8 cm (2-3 inces) shorter that the length of your upper leg. This will provide you maximum leg support while allowing you to comfortably adjust your knee angle.
measures.gifDesc: As seat depth decreases, pressure increases.

measures.name: Back Rest Height
measures.desc: The distance from the top of the seat tube to the top of the seat post. The height of the seat back plays a role in providing trunk stability.
measures.details: The height of the backrest, in combination with the relation between front and rear seat height, helps provide trunk stability.  In determining seatback height it is important to assess your level of trunk control as well as the amount of times you need to lean back to perform an activity of daily living (cooking, cleaning, dressing, undressing, etc.). When measuring seatback height, remember to factor in the height of the cushion you will be sitting on.  On a TiArrow frame it is easier to lower a seatback that is too high than to raise a seatback that is too low.
measures.tip: The easiest way to determine backrest height is to assess how satisfied you are with your current backrest height and make the necessary adjustments.
measures.gifDesc: As the seatback gets taller, trunk stability increases but range of motion decreases.

measures.name: Rear Seat Height
measures.desc: The distance from the back of your seat to the floor.
measures.details: The rear seat height effects how you interact with your wheels.  Sitting a little taller will give you an easier push and the research suggests that it is better for the long term health of your shoulders.  However, a lower seat height can really enhance your stability if you have low trunk control.Most therapists say that the correct seat height is one where your fingers touch the rear axle when you hang your arms straight down from your shoulders.  Measure your current rear seat height and see if you would like to make any adjustments.
measures.tip: In general, the front seat height should be about 5 cm (2 inches) higher than the rear seat height.  If the front seat height is even higher, it will serve to increase your stability.
measures.gifDesc: As the seat height increases, push ergonomics get better, but stability decreases.

measures.name: Front Seat Height
measures.desc: The distance from the front of your seat to the floor.
measures.details: The interaction between the front seat height and rear seat height creates a seat that tilts back slightly.  Therapists refer to this property as "Dump".  If the front seat height is significantly higher than the rear seat height, it will serve hold you in the seat a little better and give you more trunk stability.
measures.tip: In general, the front seat height should be about 5 cm (2 inches) higher than the rear seat height.  If the front seat height is even higher, it will serve to increase your stability.
measures.gifDesc: As the front seat height increases, stability increases.

measures.name: Foot Rest Width
measures.desc: The width of the flat portion of the foot rest.
measures.details: Foot rest width is generally a personal preference.  Some people like the comfort of a wide foot rest, where others prefer the compactness and maneuverability of narrow foot rest.  Make certain that your foot rest is at least as wide as your feet when wearing a pair of shoes.
measures.tip: The foot rest should be at least as wide as your feet when wearing a pair of shoes.
measures.gifDesc: As the foot rest width increases, the size of the wheelchair increases.

measures.name: Foot Rest Height - Adjustable
measures.desc: The distance from the floor to the top of the foot rest.
measures.details: A foot rest should be just high enough to hold your feet securely.  This will push your knees up and take pressure off the back of your legs. The height of a foot rest is adjustable so you will be able to fine tune it after your chair has been built.
measures.tip: The foot rest should be just high enough so that your feet are properly supported.
measures.gifDesc: As the foot rest height increases, pressure on the back of your legs decreases.

measures.name: Axle Position (Adjustable)
measures.desc: The distance from the front of the seatback post to the center of the axle. Axle position is one of the most important factors in determining the agility of your wheelchair.
measures.details: The axle position affects how easy it is to push and turn your chair (agility) as well as how easy it is for your chair to tip over backwards.  The further forward you place your axle the easier it is to push and turn, though it is also easier for your chair to tip over backwards.
measures.tip: While your chair will roll better by moving your axle forwards, if you are unsure on an axle position it is always better to err on a position set closer to the back of the chair.  On most TiArrow frames you will be able to make adjustments after you?ve tried your new chair.
measures.gifDesc: As the axle position moves forwards, the chair gets more tippy but also more agile.

name: CKF
desc: The TiArrow CKF combines the impeccable seat ergonomics and smooth ride of the CKE, with the added functionality of removeable side guards and a foldable backrest. Available in titanium only (standard sizes only).
